result.execSummary:
The defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.  Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges.  All to be paid through collection from DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.   Any amount remaining due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.

Concurrent with: Concurrent to any other  sentence  the defendant is currently serving.
**9/24/2014  Credit amended to zero days.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with the victim Adam W.

Comply with the standard rules of Extended supervision. 
Cooperate and particpate with the following and follow any recommended treatment:   anger management counseling, cognitive behavioral/decision making program,  and any other counseling programs deemed appropriate by the probation department.
Restitution set at zero.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment.  Follow any recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Herbert Martinez Pirtle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: - denying request for sentence reduction, signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence reduction.
Amending Judgment of Conviction; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit order.

Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

PSI reviewed.
Court heard sentencing recommendations.
Additional statements made by defendant's mother, LaShawn R., and the defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to the Wisconsin State Prison for a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, concurrent to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving, with credit for 102 DAYS time served.  
Court ordered 3 YEARS for the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT and 3 YEARS of EXTENDED SUPERVISION.

Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Court finds the defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Comply with the standard rules of extended supervision.
* No contact with the victim, Adam W.
* Cooperate and participate with anger management counseling and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with a cognitive behavioral/decision making program and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with any other counseling progams deemed appropriate by the Probation Department.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge.    The Court ordered the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  The Court ordered the court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing to convert to a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS: 
* Court set restitution at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Copy of defendant's HSED diploma.
INELIGIBLE VOTING NOTICE AND ACKNOWLEDGEMENT; filed.

Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle IN CUSTODY.  Catelin Autumn Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form tendered to the Court.

AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.   

**Upon State's request, Court ORDERS a PSI with a recommendation. 

  (DEFENDANT REMANDED WITHOUT BAIL INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Case adjourned to 04-16-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
FILED, Order for Presentence Investigation Report.

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle not in court, in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests a projected plea hearing date.
Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 03-11-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in court with Michael Beckman, student intern under the supervision of attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case was originally calendared for January 28, 2014. Courthouse complex was closed, case heard today.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision and Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Adam W.

Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Herbert Martinez Pirtle in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
